entry.title: [views_ax]Migrating ui/views/ + others from OverrideIsIgnored to new setters.
entry.content:
This CL migrates callers from using OverrideIsIgnored to the new

ViewAccessibility setters.



There is no behavior change.



For the time being we don't remove the OverrideIsIgnored pipeline,

that is done in the follow up CLs. Those CLs will also update any

existing Views to use the new pipeline.

entry.title: Conditionally snap the decoration line geometry
entry.content:
For text decorations on SVG text we don't want to snap the position of

them because that may produce poor results in some cases. We already

don't round the thickness of the decoration line.



In DecorationLinePainter::DrawLineForText() only call SnapYAxis()

conditionally based on if a cc::PaintFlags is passed - which currently

mean that SVG text is being painted. Other decoration styles than solid

are not supported yet on SVG text.



Bug: 40887872

Change-Id: I420da536c6bb81ddec481e5effbf32a65163c14e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5335369

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267946}

entry.title: [views_ax] Migrated from OverrideLabelledBy to SetName(View&)
entry.content:
This CL migrates calls to OverrideLabelledBy to calls to the new setter.



These have equivalent behavior.



This is a continuation of CL:5309768 which is part of a project

to transition the querying of accessible data from a "pull" system

to a "push" system.



There is no need for the NameFrom parameter since the default one

for the current use cases is simply to use kRelatedElement.



There are no behavior changes.



Bug: 325137417

entry.title: Add a new method Exo::Buffer::GetBufferId.
entry.content:
Add a new method GetBufferId() in exo::Buffer which

returns GpuMemoryBuffer pointer as the BufferId.



This BufferId can be used as a unique id to identify the

GMB as well as a bool to identify of the exo::Buffer contains

the GMB or not.



Update exo::Buffer and exo::Surface to use this BufferId() instead of

gfx_buffer() and GMB pointer directly as a bool.

entry.title: Relax AImageReader max queue size restriction for BroadCom tv.
entry.content:
Currently AImageReader max queue size is set to 1 for all android tvs

since most of them do not support more than 1 images. This can cause

flickering and black frames for some devices during video playback.



Relax this restriction by manufacturer name Broadcom since it

supports more than 1 image.

entry.title: web_app: Fixed the issue where the height of the installation dialog box is too large.
entry.content:
After BoxLayout was modified to LayoutManagerBase, the cache of

LayoutManagerBase became the main reason for layout failure. Setting the

height of the image in the Layout method of ImageCarouselView failed to

trigger the cache failure of LayoutManagerBase. This requires us to get

the correct preferred size from the very beginning.

entry.title: [SHv2] Remove undo snack bar for 'Done' state
entry.content:
Safety Hub modules Unused Site Permissions and Notifications offer to

the user the list of origins for review and actions to take on them.

Each action currently is followed by 'Undo' snack bar. However, for

cases where the action leads to 'Done' state the 'Undo' snack bar is

redundant since the state already has the undo button itself.

This CL removes the snack bar for these scenarios.



Notifications module scenarios:

- Multiple/Single origin(s) for review -> Click 'Block All'

- Single origin for review -> Click 'Block'/'Allow'/'Reset'



Unused Site Permissions module:

- Multiple/Single origin(s) for review -> Click 'Got it'

- Single origin for review -> Click 'Allow again'



While at it, fix a few things for Notifications module

'Single origin for review' -> click 'Block all' case. Namely:

- Fix the wrong metric value recording. Namely, 'Undo' button click results in recording .UNDO_BLOCK instead of .UNDO_BLOCK_ALL enum value.

- Fix the snack bar and the 'Done' state header strings.



Potentially this also fixes the issues in b/41483087.



Bug: 1443466

Fixed: 1510537, 1517702, 1517705

Recording: http://dr/file/d/1jMTMp1cVGssBVTDEE7l2IPr2onOMcMuj/view

Change-Id: Ia6f089dc1b7c6a51bdf4db02f17750f48970bc25

entry.title: [Android TRM] Remove module if it hides after already being shown.
entry.content:
It's possible for the Tab Resumption Module to show in the Magic Stack

at first, and then hides. This can happen for:

* Permission change, e.g., change in login or sync status.

* Transient loading: Stale suggestions are first shown, but update

reveals empty suggestions.

* (Upcoming) Transient loading involving placeholders.



Previously we simply set module visibility to NONE to hide a TRM that's

already shown. However, now that the TRM is integrated into the

Magic Stack, this is insufficient. A symptom of this is the presence of

blank spaces where the TRM used to be.



The fix is simple: Call ModuleDelegate.removeModule() when we hide the

TRM, after it already has been shown.



This CL also refactors the Mediator:

* Remove |mHasPreviousLoad|.

* Make the Mediator a finite state machine where |mModuleState| can be

{INIT, SHOWN, GONE}.

Here, INIT replaces |mHasPreviousLoad = false|, SHOWN replaces

|suggestions != null|, and GONE replaces |suggestions == null|.

* Non-self-loop irreversible transitions:

* INIT -> SHOWN: Call ModuleDelegate.onDataReady().

* INIT -> GONE: Call ModuleDelegate.onDataFetchFailed().

* SHOWN -> GONE: Call ModuleDelegate.removeModule().

entry.title: NSS: Prevent Chrome from crash on public slot in tests
entry.content:
Chrome is intentionally crashing when it fails to load the public

slot. In tests this can also happen if the public slot is not faked

correctly. Add a code branch that only compiles for tests to

prevent the crash.



This wasn’t a problem until now because NssService is created on

demand, but the upcoming changes around Kcer always check NSS on

profile creation. In unit tests there is no common place where it

can be conveniently faked, so fix it with a “for testing” branch

in the implementation.

entry.title: WebUI: Ensure initial render in CrLitElement when focus() is called.
entry.content:
The following pattern

dom-if > parent PolymerElement -> child LitElement

is already known to cause an odd case where a LitElement is connected

to the DOM, but its connectedCallback has not triggered yet.



This CL extends existing logic to ensure an initial render when the $

dictionary is accessed, to also happen when the focus() method is

called.



This is necessary since in upcoming Lit migration CLs it was discovered

that focus() calls can silently result in a no-op when the case above

happens. More specifically this is in preparation of migrating

cr-icon-button to Lit, which adds a `tabindex` as part of its initial

render, and without it is non-focusable.



Addressing this in the CrLitElement base class, seems better than

only doing this in cr-icon-button's focus(), since other elements can

suffer from the same issue.

entry.title: Implement a thread pool system for RealtimeAudioWorkletThread
entry.content:
This change implements a thread management system can contain up to 4 concurrent real-time threads based on “first come first served”

policy:

- The 1st ~ 3rd threads are a “dedicated” thread.

- The 4th thread is a “shared” thread: Starting from the 4th

AudioWorklet, all subsequent contexts will share the same thread

for the AudioWorklet operation.

- The thread creation is on-demand; the thread pool starts with zero

thread and create one when requested from the client up to 4

threads.



Also this change is only applicable to the top-level frame; the threading system in an iframe will share a single backing thread for all AudioWorklet operation within a document.

entry.title: Reland "Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b46fadd958b824bb6e3cedbf3c2415d6bec3b5f6.



Reason for reland: Added missing deps



Original change's description:

> Revert "Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect"

>

> This reverts commit c6ebc3f815d64748a9eabd3a4fb05afb91f6b8d9.

>

> Reason for revert: only suspect for build breakage, see https://crbug.com/327241558

>

> Original change's description:

> > Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect

> >

> > Our java and native build graphs are meant to be independent, but

> > sometimes deps are added between them. The deps do not do anything, but

> > slow down builds by reducing parallelism. These checks should prevent

> > such deps from being introduced.

> >

> > To achieve this parallelism, adds an "asset_deps" field to android_apk

> > and android_bundle_module targets that enable adding deps directly to

> > the "package_apk" step. This was needed for

> > libchrome_unwind_table_assets and loadable_modules.

entry.title: KcerFactory: Fix NSS retrieval
entry.content:
Use base::BindOnce instead of base::BindPostTask for the callback

for the NSS getter. The returned NSS database is only guaranteed

to be valid in one task, but base::BindPostTask creates an

intermediate task that posts the target task on a given task

runner.



The additional reposting of the task is unnecessary, it is running

on the correct sequence either way.



Bug: b/264387231

Test: Existing automated tests

entry.title: Add PlusAddressWebDataService
entry.content:
The WebDataService is responsible for posting tasks from the UI thread

to the DB sequence and querying PlusAddressTable there. As such, it

mirrors PlusAddressTable's API.

For read requests, results are returned to a WebDataServiceConsumer. For

that, a new WDResultType for PlusAddresses is defined.



PlusAddressWebDataService is owned and created by the (profile scoped)

WebDataServiceWrapper. A function is added to WebDataServiceFactory (the

class managing the profile and the account scoped WebDataServiceWrapper)

to retrieve the PlusAddressWebDataService.

Later CLs will use that to inject the PlusAddressWebDataService into the

PlusAddressService, so it can access the database.

entry.title: Call PayDM directly
entry.content:
Instead of forwarding calls to PayDM functions through the PDM, this

function uses the PDM's PayDM getter instead. This CL was generated

almost entirely automatically with this script:



for f in GetIbanByGUID

GetIbanByInstrumentId

GetFlatRateBenefitByInstrumentId

GetCategoryBenefitByInstrumentIdAndCategory

GetMerchantBenefitByInstrumentIdAndOrigin; do

./tools/git/mffr.py -f $f"\(" "payments_data_manager()."$f"("

done

git checkout components/autofill/core/browser/payments_data_manager.*

git cl format



After running this script, the definitions/implementations of these

functions were removed from the PDM manually.



The above functions were chosen for this first CL, since:

- They don't have usages that require non-components/autofill OWNER

approval.

- They are non-virtual, so no tests need to change.

Future CL will tackel more complicated renamings.

entry.title: Enable CertDbInitializer in lacros browser tests
entry.content:
Originally CertDbInitializerFactory was configured to not create

service instances on profile creation in tests (as it does in real

Lacros) because an attempt to use crosapi was breaking a lot of tests.

Now it’s not an issue anymore and it’s better to make it behave

more realistically. And it’s also now needed as a dependency of

another component (Kcer).



Update the KeyedService GuestProfile test. CertDbInitializer is

responsible for making certificates work in Lacros, which is also

relevant for guest users. OTR guest profiles are redirected to the

original profile, same as for non-guest profiles.

entry.title: Migrate consumer/enterprise RT suffixes to patterned histograms
entry.content:
Changes:

- The entry SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.{UserCategory} which was

previously separate from SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result is now

merged with it, and the description is modified.

- The RealTimeUrlCheckUserCategory variants descriptions are modified.

- SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.* histograms have typos fixed from

unneeded periods (from IsMainframe removal: crrev.com/c/5274211).

- The ".None" suffix is never expected to be logged. Histogram

SafeBrowsing.RT.Request.ReferrerChainLength.None is now removed,

and SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result..None is removed instead of

corrected to SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.None.

entry.title: 🧇 Enable skip_for_3p by default, tweak completion check timing
entry.content:
The timing of checking whether a DSE choice has already been made is

also changed in this CL, because it will allow us to distinguish

better between cases where we are not showing the choice screen

because the DSE was not Google before choice prompts and the cases

where the DSE is not Google because of a completed choice prompt.



Previously this was not significant because the user could not select

a custom or otherwise incompatible search engine through the choice

screens.



Bug: 326579197

entry.title: [//content] Have PepperGraphics2DHost get texture target from ClientSI
entry.content:
This CL updates PepperGraphics2DHost to get the texture target via the

SharedImage that it creates rather than via

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget(). The change is a behavioral no-op due to

the following:



* The BufferFormat that PepperGraphics2DHost currently passes to

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget() is computed from the SharedImageFormat

that it supplies to the SharedImages that it creates

* The texture target is currently defaulted to GL_TEXTURE_2D and

changed only if the SharedImage is an overlay candidate. SCANOUT

usage is added to the SI only iff it is an overlay candidate as well,

and ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage) will return

GL_TEXTURE_2D if it does not have SCANOUT usage, while if it does

have SCANOUT usage it will call through to

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget().

* While this class may cache and reuse a SharedImage, the SharedImages

are always created with the same format, and the computation of

whether a SharedImage is an overlay candidate is also based on static

information that will not change throughout the lifetime of the

program



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: Ic4e084aef4a5278bcffaadf846f592668ea3d384

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331886

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

entry.title: graphite: Do not use non-volatile promise images with swiftshader
entry.content:
Instead of unconditionally using non-volatile promise images on Mac,

check if the Dawn device is using Metal. If it's using swiftshader the

DawnFallbackImageRepresentation that's used doesn't cache textures

between accesses so using non-volatile promise images is incorrect.

entry.title: [iOS] Remove CHECK for the SendTabToSelf coordinator
entry.content:
When the SendTabToSelf UI is presented after a Sign-in, there is a

delay between the moment the Sign-in is done and the UI is shown,

allowing the Sync model to get the "other devices" data.

It seems that in some cases, this is slow enough for the user to open

the SendTabToSelf UI another time.



The correct fix is to show a spinner or something indicating to the user

that something is happening. However, considering the usage of this

feature, it is not worth adding this level of complexity.



This CL removes the CHECK, allowing to re-enter the feature.



Fixed: 326131561

entry.title: Reland "Use ReadData() instead of BeginReadData()"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e3a93f5f9e142d574afa545a0423c6b5fc27a43d.

`RaceNetworkRequestReadBufferManager::ReadData()` was intended to return

base::span of the existing |buffer_| which includes the unconsumed data,

when there is remaining data in |buffer_|. Howenver, IOBuffer::span()

always returns the span with the size of the whole buffer (including

already consumed data), even when some part of data is already consumed,

and that hits crash.



So this reland appends changes to make `ReadData()` returns the subspan

of |buffer_| which only has remaining data size, and tests in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331919/1..2





Original change's description:

> Use ReadData() instead of BeginReadData()

>

> This is a preliminary change to split ReadAndWrite() method in

> ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient.

>

> At a high-level, the current ReadAndWrite() operations are following:

> 1. Begin read operation.

> 2. Write data to another buffer.

> 3. End read operation.

>

> This operation requires the read data pipe API call twice (1 and 3), and

> that makes the function separation difficult.

>

> This CL updates ReadAndWrite() not to read data via two phase approach,

> but use ReadData() and store the buffer data in the class.

>

> After this CL, the read operation is completed at once, and the new data

> won't be stored unless all buffered data in the member are consumed.

>

> Bug: 40943349

> Change-Id: I6e5a4bac3d0829d7122a1a750805bb0c13abe9ec

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5330307

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266872}



Bug: 40943349, 327659110

Change-Id: Iaf59645d868b50780f68d453ada44de9ddbac3b1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331919

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

entry.title: [ios] Integrate account bookmarks into ExternalFileRemoverImpl
entry.content:
Before this patch, the class verified bookmarked URLs using

LocalOrSyncableBookmarkModelFactory, but this only gives a partial view

as account bookmarks may also exist (AccountBookmarkModelFactory).



A simple way to integrate with both sets of bookmarks is to use the

merged view that BookmarkModelFactory provides.



In this particular case, it is necessary to extend

bookmarks::CoreBookmarkModel with a new function, moved to the base

class from components:BookmarkModel. This is possible because the

function signature and semantics are merge-friendly.

entry.title: [android] IdentityErrorCardPreference: update view in initialize()
entry.content:
AccountManagementFragment calls IdentityErrorCardPreference::initialize

after inflating and adding the preferences. Thus onAttach() and hence

setting the error card, is called before initialize(). This leads to

not showing the error card in some cases. This fixes this by updating

the view from initialize() directly.

entry.content:

devtools instrumentation dumping. Having the process type tag in the

filename for startup profiles is useful for manual inspection and will

be necessary for when we remove the `devtools_instrumentation_dumping`

compiler flag.

entry.title: Revert "Use a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a7fa6958b26d809a90af45445a28bf171bd20d9a.



Reason for revert: This CL causes consistent failures on iOS bots. For example: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-simulator?createdBefore=1709548883



Original change's description:

> Use a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage

>

> Part 2 of 2 for "Allow incremental adoption of -Wunsafe-buffer-usage

> at a per-file (either header or source file) granularity."

>

> A key difficulty of spanification is that of incremental application

> of the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage warning:

> * First, textual includes mean that it's not possible to turn on the

> warning for a header file only. It has to be enabled for a cc file

> at a time.

> * Then, enabling it for a cc file also transitively applies it to every

> header it touches.

> * And, enabling it on separate cc files requires splitting up our GN

> build targets quite awkwardly, and will require a huge amount of

> churn.

>

> Clang itself does not provide a way to specify a warning should be

> enabled only for certain files (crbug.com/41497066).

>

> In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323341

> we introduced the 'unsafe-buffers' plugin, which is able to apply

> -Wunsafe-buffer-usage at the individual file level. In this CL, we

> enable use of the plugin, and remove other existing mechanisms.

>

> We add a list of checked file-path prefixes in

> //build/config/unsafe_buffers_paths.txt which are read by the plugin

> so that individual headers, cc files, and eventually directories

> can have the warning enabled for them in an incremental manner

> without requiring changes to the plugin or clang rolls.

>

> In order to rebuild targets when the paths change, the path prefixes

> file is added to the `inputs` set in GN for every C/C++ target.

> However Reclient does not respect `inputs` for C/C++. It must for

> Rust, to support `include!()`, and it will need to in the future to

> support `#embed` in C. A workaround is added for this file in

> //build/config/rbe.gni that just sticks the file in the command

> line to rewrapped explicitly, passing it as `-inputs`. See

> crbug.com/326584510 for this Reclient bug.

>

> We remove the UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_BEGIN and

> UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_END macros which were used to wrap header

> includes and exclude them from unsafe-buffers checks as they

> no longer provide additional value. Headers will only be checked

> if they are opted in through the unsafe-buffers plugin.

>

> And we remove the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage command line argument

> from cflags as we use the plugin to do this job now. One day when

> the codebase is clean, we can turn this warning on globally. The

> dream.

>

> Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510

> Change-Id: I03c43c2a6ab5552f58c6fcd0cb885ad2ce1460d7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5324046

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267242}



Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510, 327928851

entry.title: Simplify policy pref mapping
entry.content:
Most policy to pref mappins are simple and therefore define couple PolicyPrefMappingTests:

* 1x default value (don't set policy, check pref's default value)

* Nx policy value (set policy to value, check pref has value)

PolicyPrefMappingTest allows to do much more, but most policies don't

need it. We should simplify this by introducing a

SimplePolicyPrefMappingTest alternative, which generates the more

complex PolicyPrefMappingTests behind the scenes.



I'll migrate all the existing policies to adapt to SimplePolicyPrefMappingTest where possible in separate CLs (grouped by name).



Bug: b:327182578
